==In use==
==In use==
â
[[Wubi (Ubuntu)|Wubi]], the Windows-based [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] installer, uses [http://hampus.vox.nu/metadl/ Metadl] ([[LGPL]]) to download Ubuntu [[ISO image]]s and takes advantage of Metalink's features of higher availability and increased reliability. If there are errors in the download, they are repaired, instead of restarting the large download.
+
[[Wubi (installer)|Wubi]], the Windows-based [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] installer, uses [http://hampus.vox.nu/metadl/ Metadl] ([[LGPL]]) to download Ubuntu [[ISO image]]s and takes advantage of Metalink's features of higher availability and increased reliability. If there are errors in the download, they are repaired, instead of restarting the large download.
[http://www.nabber.org/projects/appupdater/ Appupdater] ([[GNU General Public License|GPL]]) for Windows "is similar to apt-get or yum on Linux. It automates the process of installing and maintaining up to date versions of programs."
[http://www.nabber.org/projects/appupdater/ Appupdater] ([[GNU General Public License|GPL]]) for Windows "is similar to apt-get or yum on Linux. It automates the process of installing and maintaining up to date versions of programs."
